commenter_b: It's a bit of a give and take, really. Housing bubbles are good for homeowners and sellers, but when they burst, it's good for the people looking to buy homes. Both scenarios benefit real estate speculators in their own way.
commenter_a: The housing crisis was NOT good for average Americans. It was a terrific thing for the realty speculators.
